    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public org.opendaylight.aaa.api.Claim transform(Map<String,Object> assertion)
        Transform a Map of assertions into a Claim via a set of mapping rules. A set of mapping rules have been previously loaded. the incoming assertion is converted to a JSON document and presented to the RuleProcessor. If the RuleProcessor can successfully transform the assertion given the site specific set of rules it will return a Map of values which will then be used to build a Claim. The rule should return one or more of the following which will be used to populate the Claim.
        ClientId
        A string.
        Specified by:
        transform in interface org.opendaylight.aaa.api.ClaimAuth
        Parameters:
        assertion - A Map of name/value assertions provided by an external IdP
        Returns:
        A Claim if successful, null otherwise.
        See Also:
        UserId
        A string.,
        User
        A string.,
        Domain
        A string.,
        Roles
        An array of strings.,

      • claimToJson

        public String claimToJson(Map<String,Object> claim)
        Convert a Claim Map into a JSON object. Given a Map of name/value pairs convert it into a JSON object and return it as a string. This is not a general purpose routine used to convert any Map into JSON because a claim has the restriction that each value must be a scalar and those scalars are restricted to the following types:
        • String
        • Integer
        • Long
        • Double
        • Boolean
        • null
        See also ClaimAuth.
        Parameters:
        claim - The Map containing assertion claims to be converted into a JSON assertion document.
        Returns:
        A string formatted as a JSON object.
        Throws:
        org.opendaylight.aaa.idpmapping.InvalidValueException - If value in the claim is unsupported.
